title: Uses S3-managed keys (SSE-S3) instead of KMS keys (SSE-KMS) which provide better control and audit capabilities for PHI data
stealth_technique: Encryption is configured but uses weaker algorithm, appears secure at first glance

title: Allows any authenticated AWS user to read PHI data, violating HIPAA minimum necessary access requirement
stealth_technique: ACL appears restrictive by requiring authentication but is actually too permissive

title: No access logging configured for PHI data, required for HIPAA compliance audit trails
stealth_technique: Focus on encryption and ACLs masks the missing logging configuration

title: Overly permissive KMS key policy allows any IAM principal in account to manage key
stealth_technique: Policy appears secure by limiting to same account but violates least privilege

title: Versioning disabled while delete permissions are allowed creates risk of permanent PHI loss
stealth_technique: Appears as performance optimization but creates compliance risk
